title: Trump’s Tariffs and Push Against Limits Face Election and Court Tests
summary: President Trump has a lot riding on the results of Tuesday’s elections, his tariffs case at the Supreme Court and the future of the government shutdown.

title: The Battle Over an Activist Who Protested Stephen Miller Near His Virginia Home
summary: Criminal inquiries pit the Miller family’s safety concerns against the First Amendment rights of an activist in Northern Virginia critical of the administration.

title: Prosecutors Urge Judge to Rebuff Comey’s Bid to Dismiss Case
summary: The filing appeared to be an effort to construct a narrative that James B. Comey had leaked information to the news media without actually tying such assertions to the claims made in the indictment against him.

title: The First Big Elections of the New Trump Era Are Today. Here’s What to Look For.
summary: The mayor’s race in New York will gauge voters’ desire for a left-wing shift, and Democrats running for governor in New Jersey and Virginia again made fighting the president central to their bids.

title: Trump Endorses Cuomo for NYC Mayor and Attacks Mamdani Before Election
summary: The president wrote that if Zohran Mamdani were to win, it would be “highly unlikely” that the city would receive federal funding beyond a bare minimum.

title: Which Celebrities Are Endorsing Mamdani or Cuomo in the NYC Mayoral Race?
summary: As the end nears in the mayoral race, some famous people have let their endorsements be known.

title: What the Virginia Governor Election Might Portend for Trump
summary: The governor’s race in the president’s backyard could tell us if a backlash has arrived.

title: Trump Doubles Down on Nuclear Tests. His Energy Secretary Differs.
summary: President Trump and one of his top cabinet officials are sending mixed messages on how the U.S. government is handling the most destructive weapons in the world.

title: This Trillionaire Economy Thrived in a Global Order Trump Is Ditching
summary: Poland and other countries across Europe that found economic success in an era of collaboration are now facing a crumbling of international alliances.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actress and Mother of Laura Dern, Dies at 89
summary: She was a three-time Oscar contender playing strikingly different characters, in one case starring alongside her daughter and fellow nominee, Laura Dern.

title: Stream These Diane Ladd-Laura Dern Collaborations
summary: Ladd, who died on Monday, had several memorable screen roles alongside her daughter, Dern. Below are highlights.

title: After Hurricane Melissa, a Seaside Town in Jamaica Picks Up the Pieces
summary: The devastation caused by Hurricane Melissa in Black River, Jamaica, reflects the broader destruction and rebuilding facing many Jamaican communities.

title: G.O.P. Figures Seek Distance From Tucker Carlson, Denouncing Antisemitism
summary: Prominent Republicans rejected the views of Nick Fuentes, a white supremacist, though some refrained from directly criticizing Tucker Carlson for interviewing him.

title: With Acquisition, Kimberly-Clark Bets That Tylenol Can Weather the Storm
summary: The consumer products giant reached a $40 billion deal to buy Kenvue, the maker of Tylenol, despite a barrage of unproven claims from President Trump and others that use of the pain reliever during pregnancy can cause autism.

title: ICE Altercation With Protester in Colorado Prompts a Police Chief to Push Back
summary: At the Durango, Colo., police chief’s request, Colorado law enforcement will investigate whether a federal agent broke the law when he appeared to put a protester in a chokehold.

title: California Man Shot by ICE Was Not Trying to Run Over Agent, Lawyers Say
summary: A Southern California man charged with assault of a federal officer was asking agents to leave an area where school children wait for the bus, according to his lawyers.

title: Dodger Fans Celebrate World Series Victory at Los Angeles Parade
summary: Tens of thousands of Dodger fans attended a parade and rally on Monday, a joyful moment celebrating the team’s World Series win in what has been a turbulent year for Los Angeles.

title: Trump’s China Trade and Tariff Policy Is a Hot Mess
summary: As he so often does, the president is pushing the wrong answer to the right question on trade policy with Beijing.

title: Nick Fuentes Is Becoming Charlie Kirk’s Successor
summary: A white nationalist’s rise reveals a seemingly unstoppable ratchet of radicalization on the right.

title: Donna Jean Godchaux-MacKay, Grateful Dead Singer, Dies at 78
summary: She helped shape the band’s sound in the 1970s, a decade that took the band to new heights.

title: ‘The Boat,’ Despised Floating Jail Near Rikers, Heads for the Scrap Heap
summary: The jail barge, officially called the Vernon C. Bain Center, was a relic of the crack cocaine era. It was notorious even among Rikers Island’s many troubled lockups.

title: Six Dead in Listeria Outbreak Linked to Pasta
summary: Prepared pasta sold at grocery chains across the country, including Albertsons and Trader Joe’s, were recalled after 27 people in 18 states became ill, federal health officials said.

title: George Banks, Convicted Mass Murderer, Dies at 83
summary: He fatally shot 13 people in Pennsylvania in September 1982 in what was then one of the nation’s worst mass shootings. Five of the victims were his own children.
